intro: You are assisting Mr Peters with his afternoon tea. He is initially reluctant to drink and has specific preferences for how he likes his tea. Use empathetic communication to encourage him to drink while ensuring his preferences are respected and any safety concerns are addressed.
description_html:
In this scenario, you will practice respecting resident preferences while encouraging adequate fluid intake. Mr Peters has very specific preferences about how he likes his tea prepared.

Learning objectives:

  • Encourage hydration with reluctant residents
  • Respect individual preferences
  • Prepare drinks to specific requirements
  • Check for dietary restrictions
  • Assess independence levels

resident.name: Mr Peters
must_disclose: wants only a dash of milk
wants half a teaspoon of sugar
refusals: will not accept too much milk
will not accept too much sugar
will not accept food if not wanted

actions.title: Bring tea trolley
actions.prompt: You bring the tea trolley over to Mr Peters.

actions.title: Prepare strong tea
actions.prompt: You prepare a strong cup of tea by leaving the tea bag in for longer.

actions.title: Add milk
actions.prompt: You add just a dash of milk to the tea, being careful not to add too much.

actions.title: Add sugar
actions.prompt: You add half a teaspoon of sugar to the tea.

actions.title: Place teaspoon
actions.prompt: You place a teaspoon in the cup and position the tea within Mr Peters' reach so he can stir it himself.
